subject: Real Estate
title: Why Foreigners Buy U.S. Real Estate
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Foreigners Buy U.S. Real Estate.

hook.text: Foreign buyers purchased $53 billion in U.S. real estate in a single year. Many never plan to live there.

buildup.text: The U.S. offers stable rule of law, strong property rights, transparent markets, and dollar-denominated returns.

discovery.text: No country restricts foreign real estate ownership as little as the U.S. Anyone from anywhere can buy.

twist.text: FIRPTA â€” a special tax â€” takes 15% of the sale price from foreign sellers, a surprise many discover too late.

climax.text: The U.S. welcomes foreign real estate capital but quietly taxes it on exit. Open doors, hidden tolls.

punchline.text: Anyone can buy U.S. property. Selling it is the surprise.

quiz.question: What is FIRPTA?
options: A tax that withholds 15% from foreign sellers
